subject: Critical Thinking
title: Premises and Conclusions: The Building Blocks
description: A micro-lesson that makes Premises and Conclusions: The Building Blocks usable.

hook.text: 'All humans are mortal. Socrates is human. Therefore, Socrates is mortal.' Three sentences. Two premises.

buildup.text: Premises are the evidence or reasons. The conclusion is what they support.

twist.text: Many arguments bury their weakest premise. Making all premises explicit is how you find the flaw.

climax.text: Challenge: take any argument you encounter today. Identify the conclusion. List every premise. Find the hidden one.

punchline.text: Every argument has a hidden premise. Finding it is half the battle.

quiz.question: What is a 'hidden premise' in an argument?
options: An unstated assumption required for the argument to work
